page.title: 06Buxton:Tourism
page.content: Buxton is situated near to the {Peak {District National Park,}which attracts many visitors keen on outdoor activities, or who like just to view some of the most beautiful scenery in England. Buxton has many attractions of its own, including{Poole's Cavern,}a natural limestone cave,its many historic buildings associated with its growth as a Spa Town, such as{The {Crescent}and the{Royal Devonshire {Hospital. Buxton Mineral Water}is still bottled and sold. People also visit the town to see the annual{Wells {Dressing.}Peak Rail is a growing preserved railway venture. Buxton Micrarium is a fascinating glimpse into the world of small creatures.{ {Pavilion Gardens }has theatres, cafes, halls, gardens, and a swimming pool. There are many woodland walks.
